doStateForaging() - Method in class foragingBee.Bee
The bee is in the foraging mode that means it has information about a food source and tries to find it.
The bee heads to the given direction until the distance is reached.

The is in the state information about a food source and is inside the hive.

The bee is in mode in hive without any information about a food source.

This method is invoked if the bee will leave the hive.
doStateReturnWithInfoAndLoad() - Method in class foragingBee.Bee
The bee is in returning mode and has information about a food source and some nectar load.
doStateReturnWithoutInfo() - Method in class foragingBee.Bee
The bee is in returning mode and has no information about a food source.
doStateScouting() - Method in class foragingBee.Bee
The bee is in state scouting and and behaves as follows: With a probability of p(.2) it will turn by an angle between -20 and 20 degrees. It makes one step forward in the current direction. It will sense if any food source is around.
doStateSearching() - Method in class foragingBee.Bee
The bee arrived at the estimated food source position and now starts searching for the food source.
